region_info.name: Aethel Region
region_info.theme: A campaign centered on the clash between nature and technology, with moral ambiguity and personal stories woven in.

creation_myth.title: The Legend of the Great Stillness
creation_myth.summary: In the time before the land and the sky, there was only the Great Stillness. Two legendary Pokémon, Yggdrys and Fimbulstorm, were born from the void and began a great war that shaped the region. A third creature, Mischievian, a trickster god, intervened by stealing the light from the sky, forcing the two legendary Pokémon to a truce. From this truce, the Aethel region was born, and from the great war, three legendary bears were born: Aquilon, Terrin, and Aurabeast.

factions.name: Cryosys
factions.ideology: Progress is the only way to save humanity. We will harness the land's power for the greater good, no matter the cost.
factions.goals: To use advanced technology to thaw the Grand Glacier and harness the ancient energy contained within to power the world.

factions.name: The Eon Remnants
factions.ideology: The perfection of the gene pool is the only way to save a species from itself.
factions.goals: To capture and 'purify' regional variants through forced genetic modification.

factions.name: The Northwind Syndicate
factions.ideology: In the wilderness, only the strongest survive and seize control.
factions.goals: To control the black market for rare Pokémon and valuable goods in the Aethel region.

factions.name: The Prospector's Union
factions.ideology: The resources of the land are for those who can claim them.
factions.goals: To extract valuable minerals and resources from the land, often causing environmental damage.

factions.name: The Frontier Cartographers
factions.ideology: Progress is charting the unknown, not in conquering it.
factions.goals: To protect the region's wilderness and undisturbed natural phenomena from exploitation.

factions.name: The Wayward Hearth
factions.ideology: We are a family, and our home is wherever we find a need.
factions.goals: To provide aid to towns and Pokémon in need, acting as a benevolent, nomadic group of healers.

factions.name: The Aurora's Chosen
factions.ideology: The lights speak to us. We are their voice.
factions.goals: To preserve the ancient knowledge and rituals of the Aethel region.

factions.name: The Permafrost Foundation
factions.ideology: Pokémon are a force of nature, and we must preserve them from the corruption of the modern world.
factions.goals: To protect the Aethel region's ecosystem from outside influence, often taking their goals to the extreme.

indigenous_cultures.name: The Athabaskan Analogue: The Interior Hearth
indigenous_cultures.description: A culture built on community, storytelling, and a deep, ancestral connection to the forest Pokémon.

indigenous_cultures.name: The Tlingit Analogue: The Coastal Clan
indigenous_cultures.description: A culture defined by its stunning art, its complex social structure, and its deep connection to the salmon and other marine life.

indigenous_cultures.name: The Yup'ik Analogue: The Tundra Collective
indigenous_cultures.description: A culture that is deeply spiritual, centered on the belief that all living things are connected by a shared soul.

key_npcs.name: Professor Aspen
key_npcs.personality: Laid-back, outdoorsy, and a philosophical counterpoint to Cryosys's cold, calculating methods.

key_npcs.name: Leo
key_npcs.personality: Ambitious, competitive, and arrogant. Idolizes Cryosys and views the player as his greatest competition.

key_npcs.name: Forrest
key_npcs.personality: Calm, patient, and deeply knowledgeable about the local ecosystem. A quiet protestor against Cryosys's industrial practices.

key_npcs.name: Slade
key_npcs.personality: Gruff and no-nonsense. A former prospector who believes Cryosys's presence is for the greater good of his community.

key_npcs.name: Marina
key_npcs.personality: Calm and patient like the sea on a clear day, but with a fierce and unpredictable streak when challenged.

key_npcs.name: Dr. Elias Vance
key_npcs.personality: A brilliant but detached scientist who sees Pokémon not as partners but as biological data sets to be optimized. A primary antagonist of the Eon Remnants.

key_npcs.name: Warden Kael
key_npcs.personality: Cold, pragmatic, and a master of authority and control. Sees the Gym Challenge as a way to test and recruit new talent for the company.

key_npcs.name: Elder Torik
key_npcs.personality: A gruff, no-nonsense elder with a heart of gold. He believes that a trainer's true strength is in their bond with their community and their Pokémon.

key_npcs.name: Rowan
key_npcs.personality: A calm, soft-spoken individual who is fiercely protective of the forest. Rowan is a druid-like figure who is deeply connected to the natural world.

key_npcs.name: Prophet Lyra
key_npcs.personality: Enigmatic and ethereal, Lyra believes she can communicate with the spirits of ancient Pokémon. She is a compassionate but distant figure who sees the future as an echo of the past.

key_npcs.name: Dr. Anya Petrova
key_npcs.personality: Enthusiastic, kind, and passionate about her work. She believes that the Pokémon of the past are a gift to be cherished, not a resource to be controlled.

key_npcs.name: Silas
key_npcs.personality: Paranoid and furtive, Silas is a former Cryosys employee who witnessed their dangerous practices and now lives in constant fear.

locations_and_plot.name: Birchhaven City
locations_and_plot.description: A bustling city with a rustic, lodge-like feel. It is a place of contrasts, with traditional wooden buildings standing next to the sleek, modern headquarters of Cryosys. It is the starting hub of the campaign and the location of the Bug-type Gym.
plot_hooks: A protest against Cryosys is organized by locals, forcing the player to choose a side or remain neutral.

locations_and_plot.name: Gold-Paw Gulch
locations_and_plot.description: A rugged mining town that now serves as the epicenter of Cryosys's resource extraction. It is the location of the Rock-type Gym.
plot_hooks: A local activist, Marla, asks the player to disrupt Cryosys's operations.

locations_and_plot.name: Port Lumina
locations_and_plot.description: A vibrant coastal town that relies on fishing and shipping. It is the location of the Water-type Gym and a central hub for the Northwind Syndicate.
plot_hooks: Dr. Finn, a marine biologist, asks the player to investigate the Northwind Syndicate's poaching and smuggling operations.

locations_and_plot.name: Fort Reliance
locations_and_plot.description: A fortified outpost that serves as a major military and security hub for Cryosys. It is the location of the Steel-type Gym and the nerve center of Cryosys's security.
plot_hooks: A conflicted engineer, Dr. Anya Vance, gives the player a quest to test her new drone designs.

locations_and_plot.name: Silverpeak Institute
locations_and_plot.description: A high-altitude research facility dedicated to the study of the region's unique climate and the effects of extreme temperatures on Pokémon. It is the location of the Ice-type Gym and a front for the Eon Remnants' operations.
plot_hooks: Challenge Gym Leader Dr. Elias Vance.
A former student of Dr. Vance, Ren, asks the player to expose the institute's dangerous genetic experiments.

locations_and_plot.name: Tundra Spire
locations_and_plot.description: A remote village built on the side of a massive, snow-covered mountain. It is the location of the Fighting-type Gym and the home of the Tundra Collective.
plot_hooks: A young scout, Fina, asks the player to help her patrol the Tundra, where they would find evidence of Cryosys's expansion.

locations_and_plot.name: Oldgrowth Haven
locations_and_plot.description: A secluded village deep within one of Aethel's last remaining old-growth forests. This village is a haven for those who seek to live in harmony with nature and is the location of the Grass-type Gym.
plot_hooks: A Cryosys surveyor is trying to survey the land for potential resources, and a member of the Frontier Cartographers asks the player to stop them.

locations_and_plot.name: The Ancestral Bluffs
locations_and_plot.description: A desolate, mystical location on the edge of the world, with ancient rock formations and petroglyphs. It is the location of the Ghost/Psychic-type Gym and a base for the Aurora's Chosen.
plot_hooks: Dr. Anya Petrova, a fossil researcher, asks the player to study the ancient petroglyphs and their connection to the region's spiritual energy.

locations_and_plot.name: The Grand Glacier
locations_and_plot.description: A colossal, ancient glacier where the final confrontation with Cryosys will take place. It is the source of the region's spiritual power, and its destruction would have catastrophic consequences.

locations_and_plot.name: The Sky's Embrace
locations_and_plot.description: A series of platforms and arenas suspended high above the Aethel region, accessible only by a single, powerful elevator or a strong Flying-type Pokémon. It is the location of the Pokémon League and the final test of a trainer's beliefs.

locations_and_plot.name: Professor Aspen's Lab: The Sanctuary
locations_and_plot.description: A rustic, eco-friendly cabin built with local resources, blending seamlessly into the environment. It is a sanctuary for both people and Pokémon and the home of Professor Aspen.

locations_and_plot.name: The Champion's Home
locations_and_plot.description: A secluded, peaceful location. It can be a hidden valley or a quiet farm, to show that the Champion is not just a powerful trainer but a wise and compassionate leader.

routes.name: Route 1: The Coastal Trail
routes.description: This winding route follows the Roaring Fork River to the ocean. The path is muddy in some places and gives way to a rocky coastline with towering bluffs. This route is a major waterway for shipping and fishing, but it is also a hub for smuggling and poaching operations.
routes.connection: Connects Birchhaven City and Port Lumina.

routes.name: Route 2: The Prospector's Trail
routes.description: This winding path climbs into the foothills outside of Birchhaven City. It starts as a gentle, forested path but quickly gives way to rocky bluffs and dry, cracked canyons as it approaches Gold-Paw Gulch. The trail is marked by abandoned mining equipment and old prospector camps.
routes.connection: Connects Birchhaven City and Gold-Paw Gulch.

routes.name: Route 3: The Northern Lights Pass
routes.description: This treacherous, high-altitude route connects Fort Reliance to Tundra Spire. It's a winding, snow-covered path that is constantly hit by blizzards and strong winds. It would be a great location for encounters with Ice-type Pokémon and a prime spot for a Cryosys patrol, as they would be monitoring the pass for any unauthorized travel.
routes.connection: Connects Fort Reliance and Tundra Spire.

routes.name: Route 4: The Wildwood Trail
routes.description: This is a dense, forested trail that connects Oldgrowth Haven to Silverpeak Institute. It is a quiet, mystical path that is full of unique flora and fauna. It would be a great location for encounters with Grass and Psychic-type Pokémon, and a prime spot for the Eon Remnants to conduct their secret experiments.
routes.connection: Connects Oldgrowth Haven and Silverpeak Institute.

routes.name: Route 5: The Riverbed Trail
routes.description: This is a low-lying, muddy route that follows the riverbed. It connects Port Lumina to Gold-Paw Gulch. It would be a great location for encounters with Water and Ground-type Pokémon, and a prime spot for the Northwind Syndicate to smuggle goods.
routes.connection: Connects Port Lumina and Gold-Paw Gulch.

routes.name: Route 6: The Ancient Path
routes.description: This is a long, difficult route that connects The Ancestral Bluffs to the Grand Glacier. It is a spiritual journey that is full of ancient petroglyphs and ghostly Pokémon. It would be a great location for encounters with Ghost and Psychic-type Pokémon, and a prime spot for the Aurora's Chosen to perform their rituals.
routes.connection: Connects The Ancestral Bluffs and the Grand Glacier.
